subject: Re: [junit] Using TestResult and accessing its methods
msgSnippet: ... Don t do it in tearDown(); do it at the end of the test, instead. ... If you re writing your own results reporter, yes. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar
messageBody:
John H. E. wrote:

> For example, (how) can I access the TestRunner's methods in the tearDown()
> method of a TestCase subclass? Say that I want to avoid deleting some
> generated output files if a test has failed (but delete them if the test
> is successful).

Don't do it in tearDown(); do it at the end of the test, instead.

> The methods wasSuccessful(), failureCount() and errorCount() in
> junit.framework.TestResult look very convenient to use. Is this true?

If you're writing your own results reporter, yes.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
